script: Here's a 3-4 minute narration script: Welcome to today's episode where we dive into the exciting world of data science and machine learning. I'm your host, and I'll be guiding you through the fascinating journey of Armand Notue, a talented data scientist with a passion for leveraging transformers and MLOps to solve complex challenges. Armand's expertise spans multiple domains, including machine learning, deep learning, natural language processing, reinforcement learning, and AI. He has proven his ability to develop real-time AI solutions, deploy ML pipelines, and optimize predictive models that drive business impact. Let's take a closer look at Armand's skills. He's well-versed in supervised and unsupervised learning, regression, classification, time-series forecasting, and more. His expertise in NLP includes named entity recognition, sentiment analysis, text summarization, speech-to-text, and word embeddings. On the cloud side, he's experienced with AWS SageMaker, Docker, Kubernetes, Apache Spark, and automated ML pipelines. Armand's experience as a data scientist and AI trainer has given him hands-on experience in training AI models for various projects. He optimized AI models to improve accuracy by 15%, collaborated on troubleshooting and resolving issues during model training, and assisted in fine-tuning BERT models with CNN-RNN layers. One of Armand's notable projects is the Transformer-Based NLP Model for Sentiment Analysis. He achieved an impressive 88.3% accuracy using advanced NLP preprocessing techniques. Another project worth mentioning is the AI-Driven Job Market Insights Platform, where he analyzed 50K Upwork job postings to categorize descriptions, predict budgets, detect trends, and identify in-demand skills. Armand's also worked on real-time fraud detection systems, forecasting future demand for retail sales optimization, and developing a CNN-based face recognition system.
